intro: Brunnichia ovata, commonly known as the ovate brunnichia, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive foliage and blooms.
